Koolhaas, Rem: An architecture of revision would maintain evidence of past ideologies for the assessment of new building and prevent a single new ideology from becoming paradigmatic and thus above verification. New construction obliterates what exists: it is loss of memory. But an architecture of revision can maintain the viable, modify the untenable.
